Kinder Morgan Southwest Terminals LLC - Charlotte #2 Terminal Butane Blending System was constructed in accordance with the National Fire Protection Association (NFPA Code) #58 (2011 Edition) for Liquefied Petroleum Gas Storage, and it is the facility's policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state and local laws/codes. It is the intent of the Charlotte #2 Terminal to incorporate the most recent construction and procedural guidance (NFPA # 58-2011 Edition) into this process. If an emergency were to occur, it is the facility's policy to notify the Charlotte Fire Department as well as the Charlotte/Mecklenburg County Department of Emergency Management.  Medical emergencies will require notification of the local Emergency Medical Services ("Medic") and Carolinas Medical Center - Mercy Hospital.



Kinder Morgan Southeast Terminals LLC - Charlotte #2 Terminal is a bulk petroleum storage and distribution facility that includes butane blending operations. This Risk Management Plan (RMP) covers the butane blending system, including the associated piping and two butane storage vessels.



The facility's worst case scenario is the failure of one of the system's two butane storage vessels when filled to the greatest amount allowed (85% fill shut-off with alarm at 80%) resulting in a vapor cloud explosion. The facility's alternate (potential for off-site impacts) release scenario is a "BLEVE" accident and associated fireball.



Kinder Morgan Southeast Terminals LLC - Charlotte #2 Terminal complies with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) Accident Prevention Rules (40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D), the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) standard (29 CFR Part 1910.119) along with its fourteen (14) compliance elements, and all applicable state and local laws and regulations. The butane blending system is designed, constructed, and maintained in accordance with NFPA #58 and the manufacturer (Sunoco Partners Butane Blendi

ng, LLC)



As this is a new system, this facility has never had an accident involving the butane process which has resulted in deaths, injuries, property/environmental damage, evacuations or sheltering in place.



In the event of an emergency involving the Kinder Morgan Southeast Terminals LLC - Charlotte #2 Terminal butane blending system, it is the policy of the facility to initially contact the Charlotte Fire Department (Primary Responder) and request their assistance. The facility emergency response plans are coordinated with fire department and the Charlotte/Mecklenburg County Department of Emergency Management. The Charlotte Fire Department has participated in the initial RMP/PSM training session for this system.



Process safety controls include excess flow valves, low-melting point pneumatic valve feeds to pneumatic valves (fail closed), 85% fill shut-off (80% alarm and 90% ESD actuation) on the vessels, emergency shut-off devices on the system and video display terminal, line thermal/hydrostatic reliefs, and grounding interlock devices.



In an effort to improve and promote system safety, Kinder Morgan Southeast Terminals LLC looks for, and seeks employee input, on process safety improvements. Additionally, the Charlotte Fire Department is contacted regarding participation in site emergency response drills. Additional actions include consolidating separate system inspection checklists for ease of completion.
